meanings.definition: The quality or state of being morally corrupt or wicked.
meanings.sent1: The depravities of the villain were evident in his cruel actions.
meanings.sent2: Society condemns such depravities and strives for justice.
meanings.sent3: The story's villain was so full of depravities, it almost seemed comical.
meanings.sent4: The depravities of the criminal mind can be darker than the night itself.
meanings.sent5: The depravities of the corrupt ruler haunted the kingdom for generations.

meanings.definition: An immoral or corrupt act or practice.
meanings.sent1: The depravities committed by the gang shook the peaceful town.
meanings.sent2: He was shocked by the depravities he witnessed at the abandoned warehouse.
meanings.sent3: The comedy movie exaggerated the depravities of the characters for laughs.
meanings.sent4: The depravities of greed can poison even the purest of hearts.
meanings.sent5: The depravities of the corrupt official were exposed by the brave journalist.
